Header.Description: Comparison of variable metadata between v1222.json and v1223.json, arranged by variable

comment.v1222.json: This is the daily mean for CO volume mixing ratio in lowest model layer
comment.v1223.json: This is the daily mean for CO volume mixing ratio near surface.

comment.v1222.json: Daily mean Aerosol water mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer
comment.v1223.json: Daily mean Aerosol water mass mixing ratio near surface.

long_name.v1222.json: Daily mean surface Aerosol water mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer
long_name.v1223.json: Daily mean near-surface Aerosol water mass mixing ratio

comment.v1222.json: This variable represents the instantaneous surface aerosol water Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours
comment.v1223.json: This variable represents the instantaneous near surface aerosol water Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

long_name.v1222.json: Instantaneous surface aerosol water mass mixing ratio at CF sites
long_name.v1223.json: Instantaneous near-surface aerosol water mass mixing ratio at CF sites

comment.v1223.json: Daily mean elemental carbon mass mixing ratio near surface.

comment.v1222.json: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. zos is the effective sea level as if sea ice (and snow) at a grid cell were converted to liquid seawater (Campin et al., 2008). For OMIP, do _not _record inverse barometer responses from sea-ice (and snow) loading in zos. See (Griffies et al, 2016, https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-9-3231-2016).
comment.v1223.json: This is the effective dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. zos is the effective sea level as if sea ice (and snow) at a grid cell were converted to liquid seawater (Campin et al., 2008). For OMIP, do _not _record inverse barometer responses from sea-ice (and snow) loading in zos. See (Griffies et al, 2016, https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-9-3231-2016).

comment.v1222.json: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. It should not include inverse barometer depressions from sea ice.
comment.v1223.json: This is the effective dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. It should not include inverse barometer depressions from sea ice.

cell_methods.v1222.json: area: time: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types

comment.v1222.json: X-component of the force on sea ice caused by the Coriolis force divided by grid-cell area.
comment.v1223.json: X-component of the force on sea ice caused by the Coriolis force divided by sea ice area.

cell_methods.v1222.json: area: time: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types

comment.v1222.json: Y-component of the force on sea ice caused by the Coriolis force divided by grid-cell area.
comment.v1223.json: Y-component of the force on sea ice caused by the Coriolis force divided by sea ice area.

cell_methods.v1222.json: area: time: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types

comment.v1222.json: X-component of the force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma) divided by grid-cell area.
comment.v1223.json: X-component of the force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma) divided by sea ice area.

cell_methods.v1222.json: area: time: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types

comment.v1222.json: Y-component of the force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma) divided by grid-cell area.
comment.v1223.json: Y-component of the force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma) divided by sea ice area.

cell_methods.v1222.json: area: time: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types

comment.v1222.json: X-component of the force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt divided by grid-cell area.
comment.v1223.json: X-component of the force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt divided by sea ice area.

cell_methods.v1222.json: area: time: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types

comment.v1222.json: Y-component of the force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt divided by grid-cell area.
comment.v1223.json: Y-component of the force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt divided by sea ice area.
